cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi NW of Ciudad del Carmen, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift east today, then accelerate north-northeast and north across the central Gulf of Mexico, tracking toward the north-central Gulf Coast late Saturday into Sunday

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings confined to Campeche–Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward through Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts are possible late Sunday with peak odds near 9%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge of 2–4 ft possible in Mississippi Sound and Pascagoula River mouth late Sunday into early Monday
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches, locally higher, could trigger flash-flooding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and long-period swells beginning Saturday night may restrict vessel traffic and cargo operations
